Then, the cash register only gave a $1 discount.  To make matters even more aggrevating, the recepit claimed I got the $2 Tuesday discount but clearly only took $1 off the bill.  So, in addition to being unable to serve good food or clean the establishment, they stink at math too.  
I've been in Phoenix only one day on a business trip, but surely there is at least some type of "real" BBQ in the town.  Guess I'll stick to Mexican food this trip.
Trust me...if you have even like BBQ a little bit, stay away from this place.  Your taste buds and self esteem will thank you.

We've been coming here for maybe a dozen years, and we've had really good barbecue here, and the service has always been polite. I think their sauce is too thin and watery for my taste, but their ribs have always been very tender.
We went in last night for dinner and to pick up a bottle of sauce to mail to relatives across country. The dinners no longer come with a roll, and I had just a few bites of the peach cobbler before throwing it away. It's always been a cooked cobbler with a little cinnamon, but now it's cold, uncooked canned peaches, no spice, mixed with a gummy pastry shell. 
The ribs were still as tender as ever.
The main reason for my one star review is that when we went to buy a bottle of sauce, we didn't see any for sale. My husband asked if it was being sold in a store and the guy said A.J.'s had it but that he had a bottle to sell us. He charged us first, $6.99 plus tax, then said that he had hidden a stash of sauce in the back so his fellow employees wouldn't find it. We didn't know what that meant, but we waited while the guy was in the back for a few minutes. When he came out he handed my husband a bottle and we went out to the car, where I looked at it. It was unlabeled, unsealed and warm. Very warm. And sticky. I took it back in and said, "You just filled this, right?" He agreed. So I told him that we were sending it across country and that it might not be opened for weeks. I asked him if it was vacuum sealed (because of spillage and the fact that it was so warm and could breed bacteria). He smiled at me and said that yes, he had vacuum sealed it. 
Because I didn't want to send an unlabeled mystery bottle, we drove right over to A.J.'s and found Honey Bear's sauce on the shelf- same size, for $3.99. So why the price difference?
When we got home we unscrewed the top on the bottle from the restaurant and of course, it was not vacuum sealed, he had lied. And he'd been so reluctant to have a couple of bucks walk out the door that he was willing to potentially get people sick.
Hole in the wall restaurant with excellent tasting food and great customer service (awesome owner at the Van Buren location). Recommend the peach cobbler, delicious!

Dry.  Bland.  Gristly.  Bad cuts of meat in sickly sweet sauce.  This place only makes me love my favorite BBQ places more (oh Fat Matt's Rib Shack, why do you have to be all the way in Atlanta??)

...and no greens on the menu?  For shame!

The food was dry. The side salads were a joke. There was no dressing. The only saving grace was the Mac and cheese which still was very watery.  Wouldn't recommend for BBQ. Definitely better places out there.
Honey Bears is the best. Get over you coupon issue dude.

My best friend and I were in a tough spot a few months ago when we stumbled upon Honey Bears BBQ. Long story short we were stranded on the side of the road and needed a good place to eat. We walked into Honey Bears and was greeted by Mark, the owner. Mark treated us like family! We were hooked up with meaty mac and cheese. Which is mac and cheese, baked beans and shredded pork on top. TO DIE FOR. Mark charged our phones so we can contact a ride, fed us and left us feeling 10 times better than we did when we first walked in. 

Thanks for the hospitality, Mark! (From the two girls in 80's clothes last year, Andi and Megan)

Disappointed...took my son to lunch & he ordered the chicken sliders, this was the absolute saddest representation I've experienced in quite a while. Not even my pork was up to par. WHAT HAPPENED? I hope this isn't becoming the norm.

I've heard honey bears was good and wanted to try it out. Unfortunately, this was the worst BBQ place I've ever been to. I ordered a full rack of ribs, and out of the 12 ribs, I only had 2 that were actually tender. The rest were tough and fatty. I'm pretty sure they were a few days old as well. The sides and the sauce were pretty good though. 

I was very disappointed and will not be back to either location.

Used to love the food at Honey Bears, but haven't been back in a while. Wife and I decided we didn't want to cook so we ordered on-line.
I will never eat at either of their places again. Amazing what can happen to a once great place in just a couple of years.
Ordered a pound of brisket and a pound of pork. Sides were cowboy beans and cole slaw.
Arrived to pick up my order only to be told no brisket or cowboy beans. Staff was about as apathetic as a funeral home. Too bad for you. Bye, bye.
No offer to substitute, no suggestions of any kind. I am only glad I decided to pay by cash so they didn't get my credit card number. Left empty handed and went to Waldo's up on 7th Street instead.
Customer BEWARE.

I've been going to them for years. Decades, even. They are probably my favorite BBQ joint (with Thee Pitts Again in second place).

I was disappointed. The meat (pulled pork) was fine. Good flavor, nicely smoked. But there was something off about the sauce they put on the meat. It had a =very= sharp vinegar taste. Now, I know that a tangy flavor is characteristic of the "Tennessee" style BBQ. It's what distinguishes it from Chicago, Texas or Kansas City BBQ which is generally thicker and sweeter. But this was like they put in twice the vinegar this time.  I know it wasn't my taste buds or something because the sauce in the pot for dine-in people to get extra tasted normal.

Then, the Cowbro' beans. They are perhaps my favorite thing about Honey Bear's. But they were also different. It tasted like one of the ingredients was spaghetti sauce. To be fair, I actually liked it. But it =was= different.

I hope my experience was a one-off. Otherwise, they've lost the handle on quality control.
I'm from TN and Honey Bears bq pork is as good as any you could get in TN.

OK, I am a Certified BBQ Judge, and was very disappoint with my visit Sunday night.  

Cold food, ribs had no meat on them, even my 6 year old said 'wow they don't have a good cook here daddy'

Out of forks, out of salad?  

Waited 40 min for cold food?  Please explain....

And one of the dirtiest bathrooms I have every seen.

Right next door to where we just moved in to and even while we were moving we could smell the pit. :) When I saw the building I already knew it had potential. 

I was told this location was the oldest and had better BBQ than others so with a Groupon Now I figured "why not". We were not disappointed whatsoever. This coming from a person who only eats his own BBQ and my family from Mississippi!

Had the 3 meat sampler to give all a whirl. Best were the ribs. Second, the beef. Third place tie goes to the pork and chicken but the sauce was great. Actually used it on my own slow cooked pulled pork for Super Bowl Sunday. 

Overall. I loved it.

Honeybears is a cutty little BBQ spot that does have some highlights. Their pulled chicken mini sandwiches, spicy beans, mac & peach cobbler are all really good. They have a great soda selection, and small dining area to eat there. Memphis style, which doesn't step to the Missouri BBQ I was raised on, but none the less still great. They always have a Groupon  or Yelp deal too.

One star is generous. If you're looking for good bbq, go elsewhere. I'm a huge fan of brisket. I think it is the true high water mark of bbq. I ordered the brisket at this location. I'm not sure what came out. 

I was given a half pound of mush, absolutely drenched in bbq sauce. Why put out bbq sauce if you're just gonna smother my order in it?  Brisket should be served in slices and BBQ sauce should be applied by the customer. There was not one discernible slice. It was like when you leave shredded wheat in the milk too long. Between that, the gallon of sauce, and the tremendous amount of grease, it was like a bowl of nasty soup. 

While AZ isn't known for BBQ quite yet, avoid this place if you get the urge. Rudy's kills this place any day of the week.

The pulled pork sandwich was good, but my wife and I occasionally found fatty pieces mixed in with the lean. We also had coleslaw and mac & cheese, which was overly salty. I would get potato salad instead of mac & cheese if we return there. 

For true Tennessee style, the BBQ sauce needs more of a vinegar base. Or at least, a vinegar-based sauce should be available at the counter, marked Tennessee style.

I drove a considerable distance to have this BBQ and was very unhappy with the meal experience. The pork was very dry and obviously old as were the sides. Price was ok but who cares if your meal tastes bad. The sauce was ok yet still unable to bring back to life the leather like dry pieces of pork I found in my sandwich with every bite. People who enjoy good BBQ should avoid this place.

I just read several other yelper reviews of this restaurant so Im going to raise my original 1 star to 2 for now and Im going to drive all the way back down to Central from Scottsdale to give them another shot who knows maybe I just got a bad batch then Im gonna come back here and comment on round 2.

I could see driving over from downtown for this.  Great, simple, tasty.  BBQ was best I've had outside of Oklahoma, and the cole slaw was very fresh (I'd go a bit less sweet, but it was nice and crunchy).

I had there bbq beef sandwich, they do pile on the beef but the real winner here is the sauce.  The fries are made with seasoned salt just the way I like'em.  service..what service just order, pick it up and eat.  I'd be back but certaintly not for the ambience or friendly service.

This place is good. Portions are of good size, sauce is a nice tangy vinegar style that works great on the pulled pork sandwiches. Beans are just ok, prices might be a smidge higher than they should be. But overall if you want some good BBQ for lunch this place is great.

I was taken to Honey Bears BBQ by a co-worker for lunch and oh am I glad I learned about this place! We went this location by the airport, but I imagine they are all just as tasty. I got the 3 slider plate with a side of macaroni and cheese. We got it to go and the sauce (a very large portion) comes on the side. YUM! I'm a smaller girl but I can eat and this lasted me lunch and dinner - the leftovers were just as amazing. Can't wait to go back! :)

Honey Bear's BBQ has a few great BBQ options. For a Phoenix BBQ joint, it is top of line in quality. I can not say as much for the service or atmosphere.

As far as basic BBQ menu options go, Honey Bear's is where it is at in Phoenix. I love their pulled pork sandwich and their sauce is fantastic. They have a great variety of sides to go along with it as well. I found their ribs meat to be delicious, however, it was pretty fatty at some parts. I have definitely had better elsewhere in the country.

Honey Bear's would be a four star restaurant with a few steps in the right direction towards improving costumer service and the costumer's dining experience. First, get wait staff the goes around and ask costumers about how they are enjoying their meal and if they could get them anything else to make their meal more enjoyable. Then, remove the ads from the table and reinvest profits into the business.

Pro-tip: Watch where you park so your car does not get towed. And be sure to check in on yelp to redeem your offer.

I am a huge BBQ fan, smoke my own, and visit BBQ wherever I travel.  This place is disappointing. I had the combo sandwich/ rib plate.  The ribs were very dry.  It didn't seem dry from overcooking, but overdry from sitting out too long.  They were also very salty. The pulled pork seemed good, but served on a plain "wonderbread" type bun.  Cole slaw was good, but not sure it wasn't store bought.  Beans were ok, a bit soupy, but I think it may be store bought and enhanced.  I didn't see or smell any smoker, so I wonder if they do any smoking on site.

The service was very slow, there was only one person preparing food and one person taking orders and packaging take out.  Had to wait long periods of time to have order taken and then again when there was an error with the order, even though there was no one in line and they were not very busy.
Amazing pulled pork sandwiches, great bbq sauce, best pork n beans ive ever had

BBQ, a very unique experience, it is a truly American culinary art form that is diverse and has just as diverse group of passionate followers.

I would classify Honey Bears BBQ as awesome, in the wet BBQ mop using kind of BBQ.  If your perfect BBQ is a good dry rub BBQ brisket, or rack of ribs, you may want to skip.  However, if you are an individual who can enjoy the goodness of a pulled pork sandwich with a generous pool of their mostly sweet with a bit of spice/vinegar BBQ sauce, this could be your place.  

I love Honey Bears, it reminds me of a BBQ stand at a country fair that didn't leave town when the fair moved on.  You walk right up to the window order your BBQ they give you a cup to fill with soda and a number that they will call out over a intercom.  

It is not somewhere you take some one to "wine and dine" but it is a great place to grab a sandwich with a friend.  And do not skip out on the peach cobbler, very sweet and filled with tasty peaches you will not be disappointed.

I love ribs! And luckily for me I found this place, every time I've been here the service has been exceptional! And the ribs are just delicious! As far as the macaroni and all the other side dishes I wasn't really into them as much but definitely the ribs! Will be visiting soon again

really good bbq joing. Coworker and I went and got some food. The Mac and Cheese was really good. I got the sliders of pulled pork sandwiches and they were really good as well. Definitely recommend this place.

Worst BBQ I every experience. Hot links were basically
 hot dogs. I was traveling from Los Angeles, Hoping for a good meal.

In all fearness, the.beans were good.

The food is really good here. You won't be disappointed with the quality and great taste. Service is very fast too. Only issues I had were no WI-FI, and the portions were a little on the smaller side. However, I'm 6'4 and 208 pounds, so for most people, the food sizes are appropriate. I had the pulled pork sandwich, collard greens, and beef BBQ sandwich. Both were freaking tasty as hell. Maybe they can add some bigger size options for us big guys? Either way, I'll be back, and am looking forward to enjoying their food and wonderful clean restaurant.

Had the 1/2 rack pork rib dinner.

Ribs, cowbrow beans and coleslaw.  All good to very good but not make a special trip for.  

Tables, settings were minimalist but ok.

Rest room was probably less than miniamilst.

Will try other places if I am in the mood for barbecue.

The pulled pork here is fantastic....and the BBQ sauce, I don't know what they do it, but it's finger lickin good!  They add just enough spice, sweet and kick to make it near-perfect.

You can't go wrong with a BBQ sandwich here.  There fries here are good and potato-ey - and their potato salad comes with a nice mayo whip celery and big chunks or potato.  Nice!   Don't expect much here in terms of decor - with the counter service and former Taco Bell digs.

I've been a Honey Bears customer for 30 years, but no more. I recently ordered nearly $200 worth of food for a party and they totally screwed up the order. That happens, right? But I called to complain, and also sent them an email, and I received no response. Beware bad customer service.

When I was living in Phoenix Honey Bear's was heavily part of my weekday lunch rotation. While it isn't the absolute best BBQ place, it certainly has its moments. For one thing, they make a mean pulled pork sandwich. Tender, juicy, and well-seasoned. Their BBQ sauce is the watery kind...I don't know what region that is from, but it's tasty. It's not something I am used to, and I don't think I have seen it anywhere else (so if you have any tips on that, let me know). Prices are super cheap and the guys behind the counter are friendly. This is just one of your local dives, but I am a fan. 

The pulled pork, beef, or chicken sandwiches are my favorites, but they make decent ribs. Their chicken can be a little under-seasoned/dry though. They also have REALLY ADDICTING French Fries. I'm a sucker for seasoned salt. Their sweet potato pie is also good. Free parking, decent hours, and TVs to watch the game over some BBQ and some beers.

Pulled is very tender with just the right smoke flavor.  Cowbro beans are outstanding.  The sauce has a delicious Tennessee style sweet and spicy  zip to it.  After the food was eaten, I could help but have a little more sauce by itself.  Mac and cheese is ok but better when I added some sauce.  Staff is friendly.  Good place to stop for a quick takeout.  I went back again and tried eating in and having brisket.  It was good but the pork was better.  You pay on ordering and are shown a tip prompt on the tablet before signing for a credit card.  You don't get served at your table but instead are called back to the counter to pick up your door tray.

Went there on a Sunday... not busy... only 2-3 other tables. The place was clean and very BBQ-esque feeling (which is good!); HOWEVER, it may have been a bad day or personal issues or ?  ... The big bald guy at the counter (I can say that because I'm a big bald guy), had a very unfriendly attitude.  Like I said... he may have just been having a bad day, BUT... we almost left before trying the BBQ. 

At then end of placing our order, we decided to add a piece of their sweet patato pie, listed on the wall menu... His response was only "No Pie Today".  No please... No Thank you... barely a grunt in reply to a question.

Definitely the the BEST RIBS I have ever had.  Tender, but not fall apart... slight crisp to the outside... plenty of meat on the bone and a great sauce with a little kick.

The food was so good I'll probably give it another try but I hope the big bald guy will be having a better day!

I really like Honey Bear's, but do have issues.  I agree from below, 3.5 stars . . . I could be swayed to 4 if they were open later, but they close too early for a late night beer and grub run  

They have some great specials going on now.  $5 for three sliders, your choice of pork/beef/chicken (I'll take one of each, thank you) . . . and these aren't tiny White Castle size, they're served on the hamburger buns you get at the grocery store.  I'm stuffed.  Add to that the 2 for 1 bottle beer special on everything, even the Negra Modelo?  Nice.  I asked when they normally have that and the girl said always?  Sounds good to me

Sides . . . haven't had many.  Their baked beans have always been good though a tad pricey (most of the sides seemed over priced outside of a combo).  I rarely order fries (but will always bogart one of two of yours if you order them) and they're better than fast food average

What I don't like?  The sauce . . . well, the sauce is decent, but barely a whiff of heat or fire.  It's no surprise the main ingredient is ketchup.  Has nothing on the sauces at Lucille's and Famous Dave's.  Was a nice touch though that they keep a warm kettle crock of it on the counter for us

I've been to HB's a bunch of times, but met with some friends for lunch today.  One ordered the catfish special, and it looked well cooked . . . truly sad that instead of house made tarter sauce they gave him a few fastfood packets of "tarter sauce".  All that home cookin', and they can't make a simple fresh tarter sauce?

Overall, still great for some quick BBQ if you're in the area.  I especially like the pulled beef because it seems to hold the smokiness the best, and I love that you can also just buy the meat itself by the pound.  That way you can take a pound or 5 out, then bread and sauce it at home however you like

My husband and I love the ribs and the pulled meat sandwich trio. Their BBQ sauce is great. My husband has told me that fridays are rib tip day but they are always out when we get there. My negative would be that we Sally do to go orders and three times they've messed it up and that they're always out f rib tips on Friday.
Pulled pork was ok, their sauce was ok too. Cole slaw was the worst I had in my life. I would say it can be described as cheap mayonnaise-like dressing with bits of cabbage.
Large sandwich pork and hot links halfy halfy. Goodness gracious. And this locale has the fries. Enough said.

I've been to both locations and its always a favorite of mine for BBQ. This is one of those nostalgic places to stop in Phoenix. Hot links are nice and spicy and the BBQ is tender with a semi sweet sauce.

Don't let the exterior of either location fool you, just stop and enjoy the flavor!

Chris Rock once famously quoted..."how much for 1 rib?"...well if I had $1.50  to my name, I'd be spending it on just one rib from this place. Honey Bears bar-b-que produces addicts, not frequent customers. My tin foil hat theory is they either A: putting cocaine in the sauce or B: hopping up piggies with opium and serving them to us. Of course these theories are not tru, but I hope you understand how good this food is. 

Ribs is a skill set. This is rib college in Phoenix.

totally disappointed .. so sorry honey bear i was looking to build a brand new relationship with you but you feel totally short ... i ordered pork ribs (the only ribs they sell) ... tougher than I wished, not allot of TLC here.  I ordered hot links and was very disappointed .. hey everybody has their own idea of bbq so to his her own
Great sliders! Amazing BBQ sauce. I was disappointed when I was there because they were out of sweet potato tater tots, but I hope the next time I go they will be in stock! :)

I was originally put on to going here by a good friend of mine last year and had forgotten about it until just the other day. I decided to take my girlfriend here on our date night and it was easily the worst decision I had ever made.

When we first arrived, I could tell there was going to be a problem from the get-go. The "server", if you can call him that, was sitting in the main part of the restaurant, on his phone, and seemingly begrudged that we had stepped in the restaurant. 

After being unable to give me any direction or recommendations whatsoever, I ordered two BBQ Chicken sandwiches with a potato salad side and a garden salad. 

The food came quickly, but I was quite dissatisfied with it.

To start, the bun was literally too soggy to pick up. The meat was WAY too watery, which I'm sure was the culprit for the soggy buns. When I say soggy buns, I literally mean that my girlfriend's tiny fingers were able to puncture the bread with extreme ease. The sauce was actually quite tasty, and is the only reason that I decided against giving a 1 star review. It wasn't until after I discarded my meal that I figured out more sauce was available behind the drinking fountains (serviced with probably the poorest selection of soft drinks I have ever witnessed). 

Next, my potato salad was literally the most repulsive thing I have ever put in my mouth. I don't know if it was expired or if it was simply the mix you guys use to season it, but you couldn't have paid me to take more than 2 bites out of it.

Lastly, there were fly's hovering around my meal the whole time. I understand you are going for the whole "barbeque theme", but when I go to eat at a barbeque restaurant, I'd like to imagine that I am not outdoors in the middle of a night by a buggy swamp. It was literally that bad.

I don't know if this is an isolated incident, or a commonplace thing at Honey Bear's, but I highly doubt I will be back any time soon. I am quite disappointed, because I had always heard such good things about it.
BBQ beef sand w fries & a Fat Tire.  You can't go wrong.

well I went to honey b. and the staff was exactly how the other reviews portrayed them, looks like they are family business own so I will assume that they are brothers, the guy at the register was distracted w his cell phone and also short when I ask for substitute but thats ok, the food was ok nothing that I will refer friends over to go out their way but they are working on the customer service per comm. below and above so that is good.

As stated by other reviewers, Honey Bear's isn't what it used to be.   It's still tasty, but they seem to be giving you a whole lot less for a lot more money.  Add to that the screaming children they have running around lately.   The customer service is still very good.  There are better BBQ places than this.

I had a $20 Groupon for this place, so I decided to try it out on Friday. The food was awesome! The portions were huge too! I had 4 meals for a little over $20. I ordered the half rack ribs with two sides.  I also ordered the beef brisket. The ribs were meaty tender and had good smoky flavor. I typically don't like my ribs swimming in BBQ sauce and was kind of disappointed to see sauce slathered all over the ribs but It worked. I was pleasantly surprised at how tasty they were and the sauce was not overwhelming at all. I ordered a half rack but it seemed that there was a racks worth of ribs (they must be some huge racks)! I will definitely be trying this place again!

My co-workers seem to love this place.  They often order huge platters for the team.  Cowbro beans, pulled pork, chicken, slaw, hot links, potato salad, mac n cheese, rib tips, and other items.

The cowbro beans are most peoples favorites.  I think the meat is always a bit dry and have to drown it with their sauce.  The sauce is alright.  A little too sweet for my taste.  I like a bit more chile flavor and heat.  The links are pretty tasty.  The mac n cheese is also above average.  The rest is just okay for me.  

It is really hard to find good bbq in AZ.  Crazy as that sounds with all these tranplants out here from all over the country.  You'd think one of them would know how to make some excellent bbq...

It sure isn't what it used to be when they first opened up.  In '86, I used to go to their first restaurant on E. VanBuren.  Several years after I moved out of the area, I returned and noticed a difference.  That was 20 years ago.  Well, I thought I'd check out their Central Ave location.  Walking in, we smelled methane gas from dried out floor drain traps.  I ordered the wings and had to take them back after two bites.  They were rubbery & flavorless, plus's, the check skin was silvery white which indicates that they were old & probably covered with slime when placed in the deep fryer.  The catfish looked weird but tasted okay.  The serving of Cole slaw looked liked it had been prepacked and was drowning in mayonnaise.  We thought it looked old because it was so smashed down, but, their quantity was plentiful.  The cowboy beans had good taste, but, were nothing like the ones they used to serve which contained plenty of green peppers and hot link slices.  Now, very few green peppers, no onions, and they used hot dog Weiners sparingly.  I asked to replace my wings with a pulled pork sandwich.  Has & Dickey's beat Honey Bear's hands down.  It had a cheap bun which was soggy and smashed down.  They don't even have Coke nor Pepsi products.  The restaurant business is a tough business, so that would explain their reduced quality.  The server/cashier was the best thing about this place.  He was GREAT!

I am a huge BBQ fan and this place did not disappoint! I have had BBQ at some legit places in Las Vegas (where I am from) but these guys are the best I have had in years! The meat is tender, the sauce is perfect, the sides are amazing, The staff was unique and the inside was cozy and inviting. If you want authentic Tennessee BBQ done right then this will hit the spot for you! I can't wait to visit you next time I come to Phoenix! Thank you for a very yummy experience!

This place was recommended by the valet at another restaurant. It's just a hole in the wall that we'd have never chosen on our own but we were pleased with the quality and the reasonable price. We had brisket and pork. Both we tender and had good flavor without the bbq sauce. We had potato salad and Mac & Cheese for sides. The sides were larger than expected and were "homemade" quality. The Mac & cheese was super creamy and cheesy. The potato salad was a bit mustardy for my taste but was still good.

Ribs were good.  Sides were so-so. Mac n cheese was too runny for my taste. Guy at the counter was new and didnt seems like he had adequate training. I tried to use check in deal (2 dollars off 10) but he was oblivious, and he even called his manager who was oblivious.

points down for terrible service

I'm writing this post to make sure no one wastes their lunch hour on this place. Although the BBQ is pretty good, it's not exceptional. After spending 20 minutes or so standing in line swatting away flies, there's a good chance that you'll get up to the front and realize that they are out of half of the options on the menu without warning. The location also leaves a lot to be desired. Highly recommend going to Hap's Pit BBQ right down the street instead.

Thanks to my new job, I've got a slew of places to try out now when I go out for lunch on my break! Honey Bear's is one of those places that I decided to drop by.

To be frank, the place could be a little cleaner. But the art and decor on the wall looked like it was orginally set up by the owners and eventually had not been taken care of for a while. The lady taking orders seemed disinterested and disconnected. Tables and walls are kind of sticky.

The Pork and Chicken BBQ sandwich were pretty good, except that it is very very soggy, the bread literally was mush, kinda gross for the bread- but good meats! Warning: Salad is just pure iceberg lettuce! Rip-off. Almost everything is a la carte, I think they just added meal specials so you're not spending so much.

Slightly disappointed but will give them another chance later.

There's not much to say about Honey Bears BBQ...  The food is not as tasty as the smell I sense every early Saturday morning, & it lacks seasoning.  The location is a little sketchy, but is very clean inside the premises and the family staff are very polite.  Personally, the chicken is better than the ribs... But I only went there once & doubt it I will go back...

It's ok, the meat is bland by itself. With the sauce it taste much better. I tried the pulled chicken and brisket sandwich. There meat by itself is no match for Rudy's.

Would I be willing to go back? Sure, since it's close by.

Had lunch here today with Hubby and a couple of his co-workers. On Thursdays and Fridays they have catfish, so I took the bait. So glad I did- 2 big pieces of perfectly fried catfish- just barely done on the inside and a nice light, crispy, and non-greasy cornmeal exterior. So yummy! The fries were pretty good, too, with a light dusting of a seasoned salt. I tried Hubby's BBQ beef sandwich, and is was just ok. We all liked the zingy BBQ sauce.

Minus one star for a limited menu compared to other BBQ joints (and RC colas) and minus another star for the young employees who acted like they were put out by taking orders. So sorry to interrupt your huddled chit-chat in the corner.

This place seems to be a Valley staple, so I had to try it despite some poor reviews. My experience was pretty good. Ordered two sandwich combos at $9.89 each. Usually don't comment on beverages, but the rare presence of Big Red in the soda machine was one I took advantage of right off the bat. Moving on to the side dishes, the macaroni and cheese was just average, a bit gummy, but the potato salad had large chunks of potatoes and a nice relishy taste. Ok, now onto the main courses. The chopped chicken is just that - 95% white meat chopped onto a bun. So, in this case the BBQ sauce better be good or else it will be one dry sandwich and luckily this sauce was tasty, kind of a thicker red vinegar style, but still a good taste and it gets soaked up fast. The Brisket was another huge sandwich, almost needing a knife and fork as meat spills everywhere (a good thing). This was shredded or chopped style brisket and I even found a few burnt ends buried amongst the meat. Hardly any fat and once again and that sauce made an appearance and "completed" the brisket very nicely. Place was pretty empty at 6:30pm on a weekday, just the way I like it.

Honey Bears BBQ is definitely worth checking out. What they lack in variety and options is made up in quality. The ribs were nice and the pork sandwich was tender. Unfortunately I will chose elsewhere next time for more options and a little more meat on the bones. Overall the food was good but nothing wow'd me.

Came to Arizona for a little vacation, I wanted to try something different so we came here. 

This is a Family owned business it was very clean, we were greeted before we even walked in the door by the owner. (Not 100% he was the owner just assuming because he was opening the restaurant) the young man that took our order was nice in greeting us, he even gave my grandfather a free cup as a souvenir haha. Well he ordered a pulled pork sandwich which he loved and inhaled,  I ordered the sliders thinking they are small little sandwiches, I was so wrong these so called sliders were huge! I'm not complaining I was just shocked at how big and filled with meat they were! I was only able to finish one, the Pulled pork was really good. The sauce it self was a lil too tangy to my liking. My only advice would be to the young man behind the counter, Smile! I felt like I was a bother when I asked for a box and a bag to go. His face expression said it all..

Some of the best around. I hadn't been to Honey Bears in years but stoped in for chicken and ribs.

They are still awsome and the slaw is spot on. The chicken was moist and flavofull. Dont be put off by the location or looks it is good food! And has been for years.
Literally watched the guy throw my hot links for my sandwich in the DEEP FRYER. 'Nuff said. Fool me once.....

Cute little BBQ joint!  I mean who doesn't love bears and an adorable catering van parked outside?  Reminds of smokey the bear actually and I'd almost  imagine smokey bear looking at honey bear warning not to start forest fires when bbqing.  Anyways, on to the review!  Fast food style BBQ- I ordered the 3 slider combo which is great so you can try all theme meats.  I liked the pulled pork the best although it's a little on the dry side.  The sauce is awesome and does a great job masking any noticeable dryness if you spread it out.  You also get a side (can't go wrong with Mac n cheese) that comes in a to go container which is great if you can't finish all your food.  I love the fact that the place is family owned and it's a great atmosphere in the establishment with several historically meaningful pictures of it.  The garbage system needs an update as the hole to actually dump garbage is tiny and causes sauce to spill all over the sides and for customers to actually put effort in aiming their disposal of goods.

I have had a Yelp account for 4 years and this is my first review,

We had attended the Southwest Cajun Festival today in downtown Chandler as we love Cajun and Southern cooking. While walking down the crowded streets looking for the next place to try we spot the Honey Bears Banner, the banner reads, Honey Bears, Gumbo, Jambalaya, Boudin, Etouffee, wish I would have taken a picture. As you can imagine the lines are 30-50 people long and you get in line about 50 feet away from the stand, so we decide to give them a try. 

Lines at all the places were long so we expected this and discussed what food we liked so far and what we still would like to try, as well explained to my wife what Boudin was. 

So after about 15-20 mins we finally worked our way up to the counter. Once at the counter we were greeted, what would you like, I quickly said I would love a bowl of Gumbo, and we will try the Boudin as well. The attendant replied, we don't have those items! With my puzzled look I asked what do you mean? The sign above my head reads Gumbo, Boudin, etc. The attendant then points to a small sign at the opposite end of the stand and sarcastically said these are the items we have. I then replied but you cannot see that sign walking by or standing in line, you should probably fix that, and the attendant replied well maybe you should learn how to read! 

Restraining myself we walked away, this was the first and last time I will ever think about eating at Honey Bears.

The outside of the building is in extraordinarily horrible shape. For starters, the owner of the business must be a cheap and evil person. It looks like they are purposely trying to bring down the property value of the whole block! The place has paint cracking, tables and chairs that shake and move when you use them, and there is an overall ambiance of despair and hopelessness when you are near the building. The owner truly should commit himself to a mental institution. While he is making a great return on his investment, the owner apparently has a business strategy that is focused on keeping the building looking like a piece of crap while he pockets the money that needs to be re-invested in the building. He doesn't give a damn about the surrounding businesses, the city of Phoenix, or his customers. None of my coworkers will eat at this establishment because of the appearance of the place. We work literally across the street. 

Message to owner: Way to think about yourself instead of your community by pocketing all the money that should go towards making your POS BBQ shack look like a place a non-hobo would frequent. 

On a separate note: The food is great! 9/10 for everything on the menu. Delicious!

Something is up at the Tempe Honey Bears, and it's not good.  I've eaten here for years, and at their Phoenix location, and previously at their South Tempe location (now closed). Food and service have always been excellent.  On my last visit, the place does not appear to be run by the family who has delivered excellent food and service for the past several decades. I ordered my usual Rib & Chicken combo with 2 sides.  The chicken was OK, but the ribs were seriously undercooked and underseasoned.  This was a huge disappointment!  As with most BBQ places, the ribs are supposed to be, juicy, flavorful and fall-off-the-bone tender.  It's something I look forward to when indulging at a place like this.  The hispanic staff (including a very young kid) who were running the place were unfriendly and slow.  There are lots of BBQ joints in town now, several closer to home, but I've been a loyal fan of Honey Bears for a long time.  I hope they can get their act back together.

Did the Yelp check in coupon for $2 off.  The guy looks at the screen and says "Yeah we don't take those anymore."  No prob...I just walked out and did the one star review from the parking lot.  The good news is that you saved $2...hope it was worth it.

I just went here for dinner with my gf and a friend using a couple of Groupons we had. I've also had it recommended to me by a few people previously. 

Location: It's like any other place on Central- the location itself isn't that sketchy but everything around it is. The inside is a pretty standard Mom-and-Pop simple decor. Dining area was pretty clean and employees were walking around regularly to make sure it stayed that way. Trashcans had those annoying small-circle opening tops on them and made discarding your refuse without getting crud from previously discarded trash on your hands a task. Men's bathroom was cramped but clean. 

Food: I had the brisket, pulled pork, and Cowbro' beans. Brisket was alright; I've had better and I've had worse. It could've used a bit more smoking/more intense smoking but the sauce complemented it well. Pulled pork was good- about on par with any other decent pulled pork. It had a nice balance of flavor between the meat and smoke and was also complemented well by the sauce. The sauce is a low-viscosity variety with a great balance of sweet and spicy. The sweetness was just enough to draw out some extra meaty flavors in the brisket and pork without overpowering it. The spiciness was just enough to complement the other flavors, keep the taste-buds excited, but not too spicy by any means. The Cowbro' beans were actually pretty amazing. They seemed like a standard canned-base with other seasonings added, which made them taste infinitely better than canned. The beans also had chunks of smoked sausage in them, which I felt was a nice touch. The sausage had good flavor and a crisp casing. 

My girlfriend had a pulled pork sandwich, ribs, and mac n' cheese. She thought the ribs were "alright," a fairly standard rib. She enjoyed the mac n' cheese and was too full to touch the sandwich so it came home with us. 

My friend had the chicken sandwich, mac n' cheese, and peach cobbler. She thought the chicken sandwich tasted good but was a little dry (and it did look a bit dry from across the table). She thought the mac n' cheese was alright but that she'd had much better. She enjoyed the cobbler but felt the filling was oddly watery and regretted not ordering it a la mode. 

Staff: Friendly, attentive. 

Summary: If I'm in the mood for barbecue, it will certainly be on my list of places to go to if I happen to be in the mood to drive to Central.

I used to go to the location on EVB; been going to Honey Bear's since the early 90's...Love Honey Bears; it's great they are in Central PHX (closer to me now); I see they have Greens on the menu (but, they were out yesterday)...Will be back; for the Fried Chicken (on Wednesdays) & some Greens...Also, wish they had Fried Green Tomatoes...
Love this place. Their meats are cooked to perfection, the sauces are fantastic, and their sides are soooooo yummy. We come here a lot to get food to go, and have never been disappointed.

After my utterly-disappointing BBQ roll through KC, I realized just how much I appreciate Honey Bear's.  Never had a bad meal here.  The Cowbro beans are delicious.  The meat is always lean and usually juicy.  The sauce is as good as any, if you like BBQ sauce with a little kick.  Everyone hating because this isn't like a BBQ place back in (insert famous BBQ town here) is just funny to me.  "It's not real BBQ unless (327-point checklist of real BBQ)..."  Whatever.  I love this place.

How many ways can you spell DISAPPOINTED!!!!! I have had better BBQ on a HUNGRY MAN DINNER. 

I had a friend in from Chicago this evening who was staying at the ALOFT by the airport. I wanted to impress him with the BBQ at HB's as he has taken me to some really great places in Chicago. This HB's was the first one I had eaten at when I first arrived in PHX. I last ate here 2 years ago when I was on Van Buren and the food was great!!!! What Happened???

We arrived at about 7:45. When we walked in both men were texting on their cell phones and did not really seem to care much about anything else. The person working the counter a tall man of ethnic origin was kind of aloof and on the rude side. I got the BBQ Chicken and my guest got the BBQ Pulled Pork. Total Cost: $19.63 which BTW was a great year. The food was out in 5 minutes so you know a lot of care was taken in the cooking and preparation. The Chicken did not taste fresh. It was soft and moist like it should be but it tasted like a reheat from 2 days past. Presentation was HORRIBLE! My friends pulled pork sandwich was served on a white hamburger bun and the sauce saturated it so much that he could not hold it to eat it. The bun should have at least been toasted.

I was extremely embarrassed as my friend threw more than half of it away.

In the not so distant past I ate at the Honey Bears on Elliot and Priest.  It is close to my home and the food was consistently good and we went every other month. I guess every chain has a BRONZE store and I guess HB's on 5012 E Van Buren St Phoenix, AZ 85008 is the B@$T@RD child of the chain.

My advice....try someplace else where they want your business and serve FRESH food.

I am Jeff and I call em as I see em!

BTW if you are handicapped they have a ramp but the parking lot is so uneven and has course asphalt, it is a major trip/fall hazard.

3 star average (4 stars for the BBQ sandwiches, 2 stars for everything else)
I've been to Honey Bear's a couple times because I really like their Chicken BBQ sandwiches, and I'm told the pork ones are very good too. Unfortunately, it's not an enjoyable place to dine. Although each time I"ve gone there are plenty of tables to choose from as it's never busy, it's lucky if you find a clean one. The combination of dirty tables and the demeanor of the employees just gives me a feeling of being unwelcome, like I better hurry to eat and run. My other issue with Honey Bear's is the price. It would be nice if the sandwhiches came with a small side. Speaking of which, the fries aren't bad, but nothing to rave about either.
If you are looking for take out or catering, I definitely recommend the food.  Just don't come here for the ambiance :)

I would agree that this place is a 3 star restaurant for sure. No paper towels in the men's room. NO BEEF?!?!??!! For real?! I mean, how can you call yourself a BBQ place, if you don't even have BEEF. I mean, last time I checked there was no National Beer Shortage. The pork was a little bland but the BBQ sauce was good. The chicken was OK, but made the bun soggy, and not from the sauce. And the potato salad was ok. We will probably not visit again, unless we have to.

Manager (Owner?) is very chill... Some people might not be used to it. It's a southern thing though! Lol... Anyways! The food is good, I always get either the pulled pork sandwich or the hot link sandwich. The BBQ is the ish!!!!!! I love it, can't get enough. I was reading some other reviews & all I can say is Love it or hate it, I happen to love it. PS: it's really not as bad as people make it seem... Give it a try.

Awesome BBQ restaurant!

I have been to Honey Bears many times and I will definitely be back. The BBQ is great and the service is good too. I recommend stopping by on a Friday for the fresh fried catfish. So good! You know the are making some crazy good food because the lines at there catering events are never ending! 

Pros
- Great fresh BBQ
- Good service
- Original tasting

Cons
- Wait times

First time in Arizona and boy was this place a miss. Nothing barbecue about this place the meat taste boiled drenched in watery bbq sauce. Maybe it was because it was almost time for closing . The portion size was not even worth what i paid not to mention bread is dry and cold. Big miss

I am a BBQ fan.  I smoke my own meats at home and am constantly looking at BBQ places to compare and contrast and to get new ideas.

Since I moved to Phoenix two years ago, many have said Honey Bear's BBQ was the place to go.  I have been twice now.

The first time I got a platter selection of ribs, pulled pork, pulled brisket and chicken.  The most remarkable point was how dry and old the chicken seemed.  had I gotten there too early to be served yesterday's reheated chicken?  The sides were just OK.  the store is beaten down with laminated booths and a dark interior.  Maybe built in 1979 and never remodeled.

This week i went again and got just a pulled brisket sandwich.  the brisket was good, tender and moist.  It came with sauce already added, i would have preferred to add my own quantity of sauce.  the bun was a simply white bread roll, nothing special.  The sweet potato tater tots were OK, not as tasty as I had hoped.  The coleslaw was average.  

1 Star for BBQ
1 star for a successful pulled brisket sandwich.

If Booby-Q was closer, i would be heading there for lunch instead of Honey Bear's BBQ.

PS - they were busy at lunch, so there must be some fans around.

I was really not impressed with the BBQ here. I decided to go because I read others' reviews and most of them said the food was good but my experience wasn't as fortunate, I guess. 

I ordered the ribs and chicken combo plate with greens and Mac and cheese for my son and I. The chicken was very dry, just slathered in sauce. I nor my son wanted to eat it. The ribs were inconsistent. Some were tasty and moist; others extremely dry and chewy. None of them were fall off the bone good. It may be because they weren't freshly made (when I went in there was NOBODY in there and while I was there about an hour only one other customer came in). 

My greens needed salt and lacked the savory taste that greens should give. My mac and cheese was just...not right. I tried saving it at home but it was unsalvageable. But in their defense I am very particular about my Mac and cheese. 

Also, there were no options for non-carbonated drinks; not even sweet tea! I don't appreciate that. And they were out of cornbread.

I would not recommend Not the Honey Bears I remember, counter service sucks. No more bar. If you like eating off a piece of aluminum foil this place is great, if you want a plate and utensils its $1.75 per person more. Beer was cheap and cold at 2.75 for a bud lite. Sides were nice and hot but the brisket was cold and the bun was as cheap as you can get. The corn on the Cobb was hot but old. Beans were good, as was the Mac and cheese. The brisket was not tasty at all bbq sauce was runny and tasteless over all I would not recommend coming to honey bears $30 bucks for two brisket sandwich with two sides and two beers.

Oooohh the good food we find in the ghettooooo!! 

So yeah, when I moved to Az I didn't really know anyone, so of course I had no idea which areas were near 'bad', and which were closer to 'good'. I moved about 3 blocks away from Honey Bear's, and truthfully this place saved me a few times. Sure, it's on a street famous for hookers and activity deemed less than savory by most, but the bbq is solid. 

Parking is ample and the staff is as down home as the bbq they dish out. Enjoy!

2 Stars is a compliment. I work nearby and have eaten here several times over the past 10+ years and every time it just seems to get worse and worse. I went today after about a year away and this will be the last time I ever eat there. 

Portion sizes are much smaller than I remember, buns were soggy, styrofoam cups make your drink taste like crap...only about 4 drink choices to begin with. The place smelt like an old Burger King and food was over priced. 

I went in craving some good BBQ and left very disappointed. I would've settled for some decent BBQ but it doesn't seem like they can even muster that anymore.

Dirty. Old. I was very concerned about the food I ate.

We got a pound of brisket. It was dry, had little flavor, covered in a watery bbq sauce. Not good at all. We ate about 3/4 of it and threw the rest away.

Several customers appeared to be using this location as temporary housing.

I always thought this was the first Honey Bears on the scene. Turns out it is not. IT is still a great one though. I know it has been here for as long as I can remember. It is a cool place and not a bad location at all.
It smells really good when you walk inside.
They give you a lot of food for your order. No doubt about that.
I had the Chicken,BBQ. I do not love Chicken. But, this was pretty good I have to say.
We got some to go as well. The Cole Slaw was pretty tasty as well ,and seemed really fresh.
I like the sause here,you can even get it to go. Meaning that you can buy bottles of it to take home.
Parking is around the back and a little tight. But, I like anything that is old Phoenix and this is it!

I dined here last week and had a half platter of ribs.  Some ribs had minimal meat and were dry.  Some ribs were great.  The BBQ sauce is a tangy red sauce.

Food I would rate a "3", I've had better, but it's not bad.

Location - this place was dirty and there was spilled BBQ on the floor near the cash register.  The cashier was aware of the spill but didn't clean it up promptly as she had to warn me to watch my step.  Another customer was complaining to them in Spanish on how they messed up his order.

Service/Cleanliness: 1.
 
Overall - this place deserves a 2.

Who would like this place?  Someone who's gotta have BBQ and nothing else serving BBQ nearby - it will do.

I have avoided this place for so long because SO many people have told me this place sucks for BBQ...but guess what?! THEY WERE WRONG.

I got the spare ribs meal with mac and cheese, and a side of corn bread. While they did forget to give me my $1.50 cornbread and I checked my order before leaving thinking the bread in the aluminum foil was corn bread but it was more like a King's Hawaiian roll, I did enjoy my meal!

The mac and cheese was creamy and in a large portion. The spare ribs were cooked thoroughly and soft so the meat came right off the bone. The BBQ sauce could have been thicker and perhaps spicier, but overall I still loved the taste of the sauce. The service was great, quick, and they were very kind.

Overall, I'd definitely eat here again and I don't know why people keep saying this place is that bad. It's a lot better than other places I have tried to find BBQ at in Phoenix.
Delicious! Ribs, chicken, mac and cheese! It's all so good!
I ordered the Chicken BBQ sandwich...was not that great. The chicken meat lacked any flavor. And the bread of the sandwich was extremely mushy. Plus, no sides and no kid options!! Just FYI...

As of 10/06/2012, I am sadened to report that Honey Bear's BBQ on Elliot and Priest has shut down. Not sure when, not sure why, but the doors are closed, the chairs are stacked, and the sign has been removed. I am aware there are 2 other locations in the valley(one on central and one on east van buren), but I hope they reemerge in the east valley.

One word.  GROSS.  

I went there last night with my daughter, and we had a Groupon.  It was the day before it expired, and I'm sure they had been inundated with them for the last 3 or 4 days.  So of course when I told her I had a Groupon, the girl at the front counter was nice enough to roll her eyes at me, and of course I told her "I see you roll your eyes at me".  So she told me because they had so many of  these coupons.  Great start.  

I got the sliders, a pork, a beef, and a chicken.  My daughter got a bbq beef sandwich.  For our sides we got macaroni and cheese and french fries.  Megan's sandwich was wrapped in foil, and was barely warm, probably because the foil had kept in the the little amount of heat that there was.  My sandwiches were cold, I mean cold to the touch, the meat and the buns, and they were not wrapped in foil.   I took them up to the eye roller and told her to put them in the microwave for a minute, and she did.  French fries were ok, a little salty.   Mac and cheese was very good, at least there was that.  The meat on the sandwiches was dry and tasteless.  I brought a couple of them home and fed them to my dogs and cats.  

I had been to this Honey Bears a long time ago, and remember I didn't like it.  Now I remember why, it was frankly, gross.   Even with a coupon, seriously, I would never go back there.  But if you do, say hi to the eye roller for me.

As someone who loves barbeque, I was very excited to try Honey Bear's BBQ.  Unfortunately, the Honey Bear's experience was only so-so.  The food was mediocre.  The sauce was fine, but nothing to write home about.  I will return some day in the future, but I am in no hurry to do so.  For now, I'll stick to some of the other BBQ gems of the Valley.

OMG what happened to this place?  We hadn't been here in awhile, but the brisket was overcooked and soupy.  The links had no taste except were very spicy.  If the brisket at Dallas and Austin airports rate an 8, then this is a definite one or two.  They say your first instincts are best; we first went into the Philly sub place next door that had Coke products and walked out.  Instead we had overcooked, tasteless brisket and RC soda and spent $30 for two.  I was even going save some for the dogs, but I wouldnt have enough padding for the explosion that would cause.   Thank God I have a good cigar to get the taste out!!!
This place is just ok.  I got a 1/2 pound of the brisket and a side of corn.  Not much to write about.  It's a hole-in-the-wall BBQ place with average food.

Honey Bear's is a place that was at one point a celebrated BBQ establishment, but it is now only a shell of its supposed former greatness.  The setup and quality are fast food, but the prices are a notch higher.  The meat tastes alright, but nothing special.  The restaurant itself is a bit of a dive (although the Central Ave. location is nicer, it is considerably more crowded).  The portions are meager.  All of this leaves you with the feeling that it would be a good $5 lunch.  Unfortunately, it's not just $5.

Why, oh why, do I keep giving Honey Bears a chance?  We were about to go to Happs' for lunch, and for some reason, I suggested Honey Bears.  Now Happs' is not great BBQ, but I am still regretting my decision to skip them today.  My coworker called Honey Bears an 8.5.  8.5!

So, what is wrong with Honey Bears?  Well, here it is in a nutshell: $11 for an extremely greasy pulled pork sandwich, some beans, and a bad fountain root beer.  I opened my sandwich up no more than 30 seconds after it was wrapped, and the entire bottom half of the bun was so soaked that half the meat came out during my futile attempt to pick it up.

The beans, well they were pretty good.  I've already mentioned the root beer, though.

One of my coworkers got the sliders, and they also had that soaked bun problem, and not nearly as much meat as the picture depicted.

When a restaurant has a menu as limited as Honey Bears', they darn well better do a good job on each dish.  If the food were reasonably priced, I'd say it's the McDonald's of BBQ... But you're paying almost as much as you'd pay at Famous Dave's, without anywhere near the quality.

Have been going to this place/location for YEARS!! Needless to say, I wont be back to this establishment ever again, after I discovered a CLUMP of hair (view in photos at own risk) in my pulled pork. Highly disappointed.

Lunch at Honey Bears BBQ today. Arrived at 11:15 with four parties seated and three in line in front of me - good sign. 

I ordered the BBQ pork, hot link, a side of slaw and a drink. He changed it to the # 1 value meal to save me money but it still came to $10.28. 

Meal arrived in about 4 minutes and everything was hot but I was disappointed in most of it. Come slaw first: slaw was tangy, perfect spice and mayo level. Definitely would order again. 

The pork and link came together in a HB bun. I got 2-3 ounces of pork and a three-inch link. Decent flavor but for $10, I should get more than 2-3 oz.

The link was good. It had good snap, excellent spice but just not much of it. 
The meal came with a pint of BBQ sauce which was unexpected. The sauce had a slight amount of spice but was so sweet I couldn't put much on the Sammie. I suppose when you're called Honey BBQ, you make sweet sauce. 

Around the corner is Hap's BBQ which I thought was better but Famous Dave's blows them both out with flavor and value.

Decent food but the counter service sucks. The guy running the register seemed to have a chip on his shoulder and was irritated at every question I asked. When I drop over $40 for lunch , it would be nice to get a "thank you" or "have a nice day" but you'll get none of that here. I felt very unwelcome here so I will not be back.
Wow, simply unbelievably good barbecue this far west!  The beans are the best this Texan ever tasted, meat and sauce both outstanding!
Haven't been here in a while but not like I remember it. Quality of the food not that great anymore, very disappointed. Restroom and restaurant not clean at all.

Foods pretty good. Counter staff is horrible. We have been here 4 times in the last month and I am completely unsatisfied with the staff. The collard greens are very good. It would be nice if the staff matched the food.

I hadn't in this restaurant for a few years because the sauce had a lot of vinegar in it years ago.  I don't know what they did but the sauce is now some very good stuff, the lunch time business seems very good.  a co-worker wanted to go so we did and I was very surprised at how good the sauce was,  we had barbeque beef and pork sandwiches.  I haven't made it on rib tip day (Friday) or chicken wing day, Wednesday,  I think.  I will review again when I have had the oportunity to try those and other menu items.
Had bbq pork sandwich.  It was good, but over priced. No lids for your soda? Wth? Wish they served fries instead of potato chips.

I really wanted to like this place since I really dig family owned businesses I guess I will start my review by saying I ordered via phone but when I called I got an automated system that was horrible and didn't route you to anyone instead it said to call another number. After placing a huge order they said it would be done in 30 minutes. I went to pick up my order an hour later and it was still not ready and ended up waiting another 30 minutes when I looked around it seemed that everyone there was waiting for food and no food was being served in a timely matter. After finally getting my food I really wasn't impressed. 

Pulled Pork-Dry
Brisket-Dry
Sauce-Weak and needed spice
Baked Beans-Very good especially with the sausage 
Hot Links- Not bad but not spicy
Coleslaw- Very good 
Corn Bread- bland and tasted old

text.text: Omg I'm at junk in the truck festival and just the smell drew me in!! And it tastes better then it smell! Definitely going back to the van Buern location!

My husband and I decided to try a new place tonight. I usually love barbecue, and when he suggested we try Honey Bears, I was more than happy to. First of all, I have to admit, I worked for Famous Dave's years ago and although I couldn't stand being employed there, they had some darn good barbecue and I'd still go eat there if there was one closer by. So maybe my expectations were too high for Honey Bears, but they fell way short. 

I got the pork brisket sandwich. I couldn't even pick it up, the bun was so soggy. Like snot. I tried to pick it up and it just disintegrated and all the meat fell out. I ate it with a fork, seeing as I was too starving to send it back. The meat was very moist and tender until I got a huge bite of the nastiest, driest chunk of meat. Like hard and chewy beef jerky. I have never discourteously spit food out of my mouth before, but that was too unpleasant to swallow! 

Moving on, the fries were good. The beans were awesome! The bbq sauce was lacking in consistency and flavor. The cheese in the mac was a bit thin. The ribs I had that came with their combo 3, well one was alright, the other one was almost all fat. 

All in all, I didn't "hate" it but I'm not going back. There are better places to spend my money.

Food was great. Macaroni noodles were maybe a little over cooked. I would stay away from the chicken was a bit dry. The pork is the best choice. Tall, bald, older man who seemed to be a manager was rude not only to me and other customers but I heard him chew out the bus boy.  I would go back but maybe a different hour in hopes to avoid the rude cashier/manager.

Service could be a lot more better , couldn't tell who worked there or not since it looked like they just pulled in people off the street and asked them to work that day , well that's the feel i got when I glanced back into the kitchen . My boyfriend and I got 2 #1 which was a sandwich with one side and a drink , I got pork he got chicken , both were a bit dry until you added that sauce which was DELISH , as I walked up to the counter to grab our order to go , I noticed all the guys had gathered up front to , you guessed it , check me out right In front of my boyfriend. Other than that , our food was alright , nothing really stood out or caught my attention besides the BBQ sauce .
Not a fan of this location. Ordered the pork sandwich and the bread was stale. Van Buren location is much better.

Absolutely loved it, the meat was tender, smokey, and the BBQ wasn't overwhelming so you can actually appreciate the flavors. Rib meat came off the bone with ease. Brisket was awesome and so was the pulled pork.

Pretty good BBQ for Phoenix!  I enjoyed the pulled pork sandwich with a side of mac 'n cheese...quite tasty!  The atmosphere is not very appealing and the advertising is quite cheesy, but guess it did make me laugh!

You know. I really don't have much to say about this place that is bad. I've been there a number of times and have also had their catering.

Their beans are very good. Slightly sweet with the right amount of spice.
Hot links are spot on. Pulled beef and pork sandwiches are good, but the meat could be more tender. I am very picky about my potato salad, but theirs isn't bad.

Not sure I understand the poor reviews.  Previous to last night I'd only had Honey Bears samples from Beer Fests in Phoenix and have had no complaints.

Well last night during a First Friday reconnaissance mission we chose to go for a late dinner.  Walking in is pretty much a time warp to the 70s/80s when things didn't need to be glitzy.  You walk up to the counter, order and you can get either a sandwich or by the pound.  We ordered Corn on the cobb, 1/2 lb of pork, and cowboy beans.

The order came up in five minutes and we sat down.  The Beans were spicy and perfect, pork and sauce solid.  Smart choice.
Always get the shredded pork to go with coleslaw and beans to make my own BBQ salad at home. Geat BBQ 25cent wing night on Mondays..grilled!

Haven't been here in a while and man has this place gone down the tubes. Took a long time to order and get our lunch as only one person working here. Drink machine was a disaster. Only 2 dispensers worked and they were out of ice. Very limited choice.
We both ordered brisket sandwiches which were dry and not very tasty. Sandwiches were a lot smaller than I remember..
Sure won't be returning. Not the Honey Bears I grew up with. Very disappointing. The place has become a dump.
Good BBQ chicken, okay pumpkin pie, and where are the yams, sweet potatoes, and other traditional BBQ stuff? Oh wrong directions on yelp's behalf didn't help either.

last weekend after some shopping my wife and I decided to get some bbq and since we where near downtown phoenix decided to stop at HONEY BEARS BBQ  what a mistake, do these people even know what barbecue is, if you plan on goin there you better pack a lunch bag the wait for your mediocre bbq is ridiculous and the people that work there seemed like they all had a bad day, there is a sign that says for you to check your order before you leave when we did some food was missing it took 3 of the employees to agree that our order was not complete so we had to wait longer to get our whole order, will we go back "HELL NO" you can try it if you like crappy food

Pulled pork and coleslaw was AWESOME!  Corn on the cob was terrible.  Sauce for dipping pork was tasty!  Pretty rude guy behind the counter... SUCKED...  He looked like he wanted to punch someone out!  He didn't really say anything rude, but I deffinetly felt like I was WASTING his time.  I will go back for sure.  They are about to update the table tops! ;o)

Love the food here. This location specifically I think is better than the other location. The mac n cheese is amazing and the pulled chicken sandwiches are very big. Staff is typically friendly but the booths aren't very comfortable.

The food is always great. Very good BBQ Pork that has plenty of smokey flavor and the sauce compliments it well.

The employees on the other hand have a terrible attitude and never smile. They never say "thank you". I definitely recommend going to the Van Buren location because this one does not make you feel appreciated for your business.

I would have given them lower if I didn't know what their true standards are from my consistent patronage at the other locations.
Food here was great, I had a bad experience in tempe but this place was great!

Well I am in Phoenix for business and this place is walking distance down the street and since I am a major BBQ-aholic had to give it a try.  Went here for lunch before the lunch crowd came pouring in.  Tasty - I had the pork sandwich with a side of slaw.  All good contenders - nothing too outstanding but definitely solid.  I like the sauce.

The food is excellent, and the sauce is the best I have ever had. The dining area is run-down, and the restrooms are dirty. The maintenance is not done well. The employees are not rude, but they are not friendly either. They do not make the customers feel welcome. I like to support this business because they decorate for Christmas using Christian symbols, rather than just decorate for generic "holidays".

Hands down the worst BBQ I have ever had. I ordered the brisket sandwich. The meat doesn't taste smoked at all. It has a high fatty content. It was served with the sauce already on it (not a wrong practice, but better to allow the customer to put the amount of sauce they are comfortable with), and the sauce was horrible. It was like aged ketchup. Also the bun was soggie half way through my meal due to the sauce and grease content. On top of that it was over $7 just for the sandwich. Why would I go back? I won't. Don't waste your money here unless they do some serious soul searching as to why they are in business. Obviously it is not what they are good at.

Alternatives are Dickeys, Ralph's, joe's real BBQ, or famous dave's.
Great BBQ and sides plus reasonable prices and service I will go back

Best BBQ I've had this side of the Mississippi river. They also cater sporting events and concerts. They had a big tent set up at the Mesa amphitheater for a blues concert and they didn't gouge you for a sandwich and drink like most venues will.

Hmmm... just having read all the reviews so far...I'm wondering if I liked this place as much as I think I did. I do recall the BBQ sauce being a little but too spicy for my taste but I think overall I really liked my BBQ sandwich I ate at Honey Bear's...or wait... did I have the ribs? Shoot... I think I had both! It wasn't my favorite but it was good and I'd go back again, but I don't know BBQ like some of you reviewers know BBQ...so maybe I'm not the best review to take into consideration.

Marie and I decided to do a little shopping today so we drove across I-10 from Ahwatukee to Tempe to check out Ikea and Costco.  After strolling through each of the big stores and not buying anything that could spoil in the heat of the car, we stopped at Honey Bear's BBQ for a late afternoon lunch/dinner.

We've eaten here once before having a good tasting pulled pork sandwich with sides, but this second time we both had a hankering for some pork ribs.  In my usual style, I ordered a full rack with a two sides of potatoes, one fries and the other potato salad. Marie decided to have 1/2 rack of ribs with two sides, cole slaw and a corn on the cob.  She also has a beer and I went with a RC cola.

Now my thing with Honey Bear's is with the staff.  They are nice to you, take your order quickly, but they are a bit stoic, standoffish.  And this could be just me, but I feel like they need reassurance that I know a bit about BBQ, like I need to say "Hey I'm experienced! I've traveled this great country and have eaten BBQ in Kansas City, St. Louis, Chicago, Memphis, Virginia and some back woods joint in South Carolina." Like I said, this is most likely my personal issues coming out, but this is how I feel while I'm ordering our meal.  Everything came to about $40.00 with small tip.

We scoop up some extra BBQ sauce, which is very tasty, not over powering, IMHO.  Takes about 10 minutes to assemble our order.  When it comes to the counter, I'm already in motion and on my way before the guy can say our number.  The tray has way more ribs then either of us can eat in one sitting.  

We both dig in with our hands, lifting the ribs to our faces dripping in their excellent BBQ sauce and begin to pull the meat from the bone with our teeth.  Now on their soda cups Honey Bear's states and I quote "You don't need no teeth...to eat our meat." They may mean the pulled pork, but I found that the meat didn't fall off the bone; you did need teeth to pry the meat from the bone of these ribs.  The meat is dry, tasty but dry.  That didn't stop me from finishing off all but four of my full rack plus the fries and potato salad.  I love the potato salad, with its taste of pickles.  Mmmmm.  Except for two pieces, my girl stripped her ribs clean.

Marie got a "to go" box from the counter woman, and we piled in my leftovers to take home for a late night snack.

You want a big wad of sticky drippy animal on a bun? Well, you're in the right place. it sounds like the other location has more selection of sides. Why not here? This place is lacking. Bring me the home fries!! The sauce was too watery for me, but flavorful. I just wish it stuck to the meat better and didn't get soaked up by the bun. The potato salad was yummy (rather peppery), but I've had better.
Been going here since I was a littls kid. Never had any problems. Always good food... BBQ :)

Got a family meal deal for home consumption.  Two slabs of ribs had plenty of meat on them (not baby back, but pork), came chopped up.  Two adults and 2 kids, despite gorging ourselves, only ate about 75%.  Their sauce is frankly exceptional.

But the sides... well... sucked.

The corn was watery (they must soak in hot water for a day or two).  The potato salad, while having the skin of red potatos and being pretty decent, had a strong dill taste that I liked but I couldn't get kids or wife to enjoy.  The rolls aren't good... but most aren't at these kinds of places.

What pissed me off the most was that they forgot one of the sides... mac and cheese.

Anyway, here's what i got out of the deal.. I will come back for the ribs.  And WILL absolutely come back for the sauce.  In fact, I may just come get a tub of sauce and BBQ my own ribs if I'm not feeling particularly lazy.  

Meat = Good
Sides = Bad
Sauce = Exceptional (5 Stars)

Enjoy!

It's good if you need a quick fix, otherwise I would go elsewhere. The quality of the food is excellent, don't get me wrong (their ribs are my go-to), I'm just not a fan of their sauces. Their BBQ beans are a must however and the cornbread muffins are amazing when they're fresh!

Not what it used to be and I don't mean the IHOP that used to be there. Food quality has really taken a dive compared to 15 years ago. I don't know if it was ownership and/or management that stopped caring, but I wouldn't put up with the light rail destruction of a functional road to come back here. Plenty of other places that are good and where I can turn left to leave or turn left to enter.

This place isn't what it used to be.  I have fond memories of coming here as a kid and ordering fall-off-the-bone baby back ribs and delicious sides.  Coming here today, I was kinda disappointed. Not only to learn that they no longer serve babyback ribs and only serve spareribs now, but to learn that a good portion of them are overcooked or less tender. The corn has gotten bland, but the Mac and cheese was good. The only reason my review is 2 stars as opposed to 1 is the Mac and cheese.

All the food was amazing - we made the mistake of ordering extra hot bbq sauce. It is no joke! it was delicious but had us all sweating and with runny noses. Ordered lunch for a group of 13. All the orders were correct. Love this place

I wouldn't say that overall, this is the best BBQ place in the valley but for what I get there, its the best. I have tried their pulled pork sammich and was not overly impressed. However, what I am impressed with is their hot link sammich, BBQ beans, and their corn on the cob. The hot links are juicy and spicy, the beans are thick and have lots of meat in them, and the corn is actually a large ear of corn that doesn't taste like the frozen kind. The sauce is very good as well. When I want a simple BBQ sammich and a few sides, this is one of the places I think of.

The ribs were delicious!!  Finally a place that the sauce was so good that I would buy a bottle.  The sides too me were nasty (potato salad and cow beans) .  I would buy ribs from here and go to Mrs.Whites for the sides to make the perfect meal.

I ordered a beef brisket sandwich with a side of Cowbro beans and collard greens for a total of $11.92(not including a drink) I had my own bottled water. 
The first thing I found very tacky about this place is that I paid with my bank debit/credit card and the cashier system this place used is a swipe on a Airpad. Once swiped it's then turned around to me with an option to tip %15 %20 or %25 or decline. I just find this totally tacky that there's an option to tip the cashier or whoever it goes to for merely ringing up my order. (Just doesn't make sense to me but,seems to be a trend of putting customers on the spot to tip or donate) I find that irritating. 
That was not the reason for my review of 2 stars. In reality I would give this place 2.5 stars. The food or at least what I ordered was well below average. I'll start with the sides. I know collard greens are probably not the most popular amongst folks but, I actually enjoy em and can tell good quality of greens. These were bland and seems undercooked. What made it worst is there is no hot sauce available for them. The cowbro beans were also bland. If you're lucky enough to have a few pieces of sausage in them it makes up for the blandness. The brisket was my main reason for the rating I give. It was dry and has no flavor on its own, I think that's why you must drown it with the house bar b q sauce. The bun it came with was cold and quick to become soggy or crumble. Overall this would not be a place to bring family or a friend that's craving BBQ

OMGosh!!! Just had my fix of my favorite BBQ! Could just about drink that Tennessee/Carolina sauce. Lived next to this place back in '93 and realized again that I need to get there way more often!
Mark even recognized me and hooked me up with some of the best Mac & Chez ever...as I was already getting the slaw and bro beans! Their sides are almost worth a trip there themselves. Next time a slice of that sweet potato pie is coming with me too 
Thanks for all the years Mark...and to many more!!

A good amount of meat on the pulled pork.  Crappy bun.  Sauce is good.  A few pieces of pork tasted like paper had gotten into meat.  The mac and cheese was crap, and so not worth 2.50.  My roommate loves BBQ so the idea of rubbing this one in when I came home backfired.  

The take home message here is OVERPRICED!!!!

Finally! An amazing place to get fantastic BBQ sandwiches in Phoenix! I went here for the first time a few weeks back (totally blanked out on the Yelp reviewing).  Some co-workers suggested we go there, saying it was one of the best places in The Valley for pork BBQ. They were right!

It's a tiny restaurant, and chances are you've driven by it a couple times but just have never noticed it. It's nothing fancy inside, just great service, great food and happy customers.
